item.title: Is It OK to Talk to My Daughter About Her Weight?
item.description: She may be headed for a serious problem. How can we raise this with her without pushing her away?

item.title: Can Your Spouse Put Limits on Knuckle-Cracking?
item.description: A ruling on a dispute over body noises.

item.title: Sen. Alex Padilla Says His Viral Moment Was a Sign of Things to Come
item.description: The California politician on his “wake-up call” at an earlier moment of political upheaval, and the one he’s experiencing today.

item.title: I’m a Screenwriter. Is It All Right if I Use A.I.?
item.description: This new tool has been a game changer.

item.title: ‘Bow to the Emperor’: We Asked 50 Legal Experts About the Trump Presidency
item.description: Before the election, we surveyed the legal establishment about what a second Trump term could mean for the rule of law. A year later, they’re very, very worried.

item.title: Embrace the Potato Dinner
item.description: A former restaurant critic, now on a health journey, finds steady comfort in these spiced stovetop spuds.

item.title: Life Got Hard. The Sims Got Easy.
item.description: As the daily grind becomes “gamified,” players are nostalgic for older, more chaotic versions of the life simulation game

item.title: Should I Keep Donating to an Animal Shelter That Treats Employees Badly?
item.description: If I stop donating, the animals lose; if I continue, am I enabling questionable practices?

item.title: Do Spouses Have Mustache Veto Power?
item.description: A ruling on a dispute over the limits of facial-hair autonomy.

item.title: How Getting Stoned With My Dad Helped Us Heal
item.description: It was the therapy we needed, and the fun we deserved, after decades of estrangement.

item.title: The Suffix That Tells Us to Ruthlessly Optimize Everything
item.description: From game theory to incels, how everything got ‘-maxxed.'

item.title: The Rules of Investing Are Being Loosened. Could It Lead to the Next 1929?
item.description: A group of financiers is trying to convince the public to invest heavily in private equity and crypto — a risky gambit with some real 1920s vibes.

item.title: Five Takeaways From the Magazine’s Profile of Zohran Mamdani
item.description: How the Democratic nominee for mayor who has stunned the New York establishment is working to shore up support and sustain his momentum.

item.title: Inside the Improbable, Audacious and (So Far) Unstoppable Rise of Zohran Mamdani
item.description: The story of the man most likely to be the next mayor of New York City — and the promise and peril his ascent poses for the Democratic Party.
